publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2787 Mr Gil Paterson: Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shopsâ€”That the Parliament recognises that the public sale and display of pornographic material in our local stores, newsagents and garages is completely unacceptable; further recognises that pornography eroticises violence against women and children and desensitises the public to the meaning of violence towards women in real life, and calls on the Executive to ensure that the Civic Government (Scotland) Act 1982 is fully and effectively enforced and to review this legislation to ensure that it is adequate.
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Alex Neil*

S1M-2787 Mr Gil Paterson: Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops-That the Parliament recognises that the public sale and display of pornographic material in our local stores, newsagents and garages is completely unacceptable; further recognises that pornography eroticises violence against women and children and desensitises the public to the meaning of violence towards women in real life, and calls on the Executive to ensure that the Civic Government (Scotland) Act 1982 is fully and effectively enforced and to review this legislation to ensure that it is adequate. Supported by: Alex Neil
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Christine Grahame*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Robin Harper*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Elaine Smith*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Dr Winnie Ewing*
S1M-2787 Stop Indecent Displays in Corner Shops (lodged on 26 February 2002) Ms Sandra White*
